BigIntToPaddedByteArray

public static byte[] BigIntToPaddedByteArray(java.math.BigInteger bi,
                                             int length)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Converts a BigInt (What is stored in Hydra-keystore and what our version of SSSS is using...) to a padded byte-array. Which is compatible with JCE SecretKeySpecs

Parameters:
bi - The big-int to be parsed
length - The desired length
Returns:
byte[] including the bigint in padded format.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

paddedByteArray

public static byte[] paddedByteArray(byte[] original,
                                     int length)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Pads a byte-array with zeroes to a specific length. Used to make sure that reconstructed keys are extended to a JCE-compatible key-size if the randomly generated key has many zero-bits in the beginning.

Parameters:
original - The original array to be padded
length - The desired length in bytes.
Returns:
The key padded with zero-bits
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
